1.brief: to be dense or dark, i.e. to becloud
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
a daughter (used in the same wide sense as other terms of relationship, literally and figuratively)
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem
to throw out, down or away (literally or figuratively)
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
ornament (abstractly or concretely, literally or figuratively)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
a foot (as used in walking); by implication, a step; by euphemistically the pudenda
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire

2.brief: to make away with (specifically by swallowing); generally, to destroy
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to commiserate; by implication, to spare
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to pull down or in pieces, break, destroy
a fortification, castle, or fortified city; figuratively, a defender
a daughter (used in the same wide sense as other terms of relationship, literally and figuratively)
Jehudah (or Judah), the name of five Israelites; also of the tribe descended from the first, and of its territory

properly, to touch, i.e. lay the hand upon (for any purpose; euphemistically, to lie with a woman); by implication, to reach (figuratively, to arrive, acquire); violently, to strike (punish, defeat, destroy, etc.)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
properly, to bore, i.e. (by implication) to wound, to dissolve; figuratively, to profane (a person, place or thing), to break (one's word), to begin (as if by an 'opening wedge'); to play (the flute)
dominion, i.e. (abstractly) the estate (rule) or (concretely) the country (realm)
a head person (of any rank or class)

3.brief: to fell a tree; generally, to destroy anything
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a horn (as projecting); by implication, a flask, cornet; by resemblance. an elephant's tooth (i.e. ivory), a corner (of the altar), a peak (of a mountain), a ray (of light); figuratively, power
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
the hinder part; hence (adverb) behind, backward; also (as facing north) the West
the right hand or side (leg, eye) of a person or other object (as the stronger and more dexterous); locally, the south
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
to kindle, i.e. consume (by fire or by eating);  to be(-come) brutish
{a flash; figuratively, a sharply polished blade or point of aweapon}
(as noun) a circle, neighbour, or environs; but chiefly (as adverb, with or without preposition) around

4.brief: to tread; by implication, to walk; also to string abow (by treading on it in bending)
a bow, forshooting (hence, figuratively, strength) or the iris
to station, in various applications (literally or figuratively)
the right hand or side (leg, eye) of a person or other object (as the stronger and more dexterous); locally, the south
narrow; (as a noun) a tight place (usually figuratively, i.e. trouble); also a pebble ; (transitive) an opponent (as crowding)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
delightful; hence, a delight, i.e. object of affection or desire
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
a tent (as clearly conspicuous from a distance)
a daughter (used in the same wide sense as other terms of relationship, literally and figuratively)
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem
to spill forth (blood, a libation, liquid metal; or even a solid, i.e. to mound up); also (figuratively) to expend (life, soul, complaint, money, etc.); intensively, to sprawl out
heat; figuratively, anger, poison (from its fever)

the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
to make away with (specifically by swallowing); generally, to destroy
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity

a daughter (used in the same wide sense as other terms of relationship, literally and figuratively)

to decay, i.e. (causatively) ruin (literally or figuratively)

properly, an appointment, i.e. a fixed time or season; specifically, a festival; conventionally ayear; by implication, an assembly (as convened for a definite purpose); technically the congregation; by extension, the place of meeting; also a signal (as appointed beforehand)
to mislay, i.e. to be oblivious of, from want of memory or attention
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem

strictly froth at the mouth, i.e. (figuratively) fury (especially of God's displeasure with sin)
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
literally one officiating, a priest; also (by courtesy) an acting priest (although a layman)

a consecrated thing or place, especially, a palace, sanctuary (whether of Jehovah or of idols) or asylum
to shut up; figuratively, to surrender
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),

a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to decay, i.e. (causatively) ruin (literally or figuratively)
a daughter (used in the same wide sense as other terms of relationship, literally and figuratively)
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem
to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application
a cord (as connecting), especially formeasuring; figuratively, a rule; also a rim, a musical string or accord
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

an army; also (by analogy,) an intrenchment
to droop; by implication to be sick, to mourn

an opening, i.e. door or gate
properly, to wander away, i.e. lose oneself; by implication to perish (causative, destroy)
a head person (of any rank or class)
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
a precept or statute, especially the Decalogue or Pentateuch
properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and

the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
to be dumb; by implication, to be astonished, to stop; also to perish
a daughter (used in the same wide sense as other terms of relationship, literally and figuratively)
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem

dust (as powdered or gray); hence, clay, earth, mud

the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)
to gird on (as a belt, armor, etc.)
properly, a mesh (as allowing a liquid to run through), i.e. coarse loose cloth or sacking (used in mourning and for bagging); hence, a bag (for grain, etc.)
